greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of pairing even numbers in the range 1 to n with odd numbers in the range n+1 to 2n such that each pair sums to a prime.
example: a(6)=2 because there are two ways: 2+9, 4+7, 6+11 and 2+11, 4+9, 6+7.
xref: The product of this sequence and A071058 gives A070897.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, May 25 2002
ext: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, May 27 2002
